issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: If an image is sliced into multiple parts to give different links for the same image a white line will appear in between the sliced images

solutions.solution:
To resolve this we need to wrap the images to a div like <div align="right" style="font-size: 0; line-height: 0; display:block;"> </div> and for all images inside that div this style needs to be added style="margin:0;border:none;" and align="left"

The following is the code which is having the rendering issue

<tr style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">

<td style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">

<img alt="" height="50" src="https://placehold.it/75x50" style="display:block; border:none" width="75"/>

</td>

<td style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">

<a href="#"><img alt="" height="50" src="https://placehold.it/85x50" style="display:block; border:none" width="85"/></a>

</td>

<td style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">

<a href="#"><img alt="" height="50" src="https://placehold.it/94x80" style="display:block; border:none" width="94"/></a>

</td>

<td style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">

<a href="#"><img alt="" height="50" src="https://placehold.it/81x50" style="display:block; border:none" width="81"/></a>

</td>

<td style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">

<img align="left" alt="" border="0" class="" src="https://placehold.it/245x50" style="margin:0; border:none;" />

</td>

</tr>

Following is the code which has resolved the rendering issue in Windows 10 mail app.

<tr>

<td valign="top">

    <div style="font-size:0; line-height:0; min-width:580px;" align="right"><a href="#" target="_blank"><img align="left" alt=""  src="https://placehold.it/75x50" style="margin:0;border:none;"/></a> <a href="#"><img align="left" alt="" src="https://placehold.it/85x50" style="margin:0;border:none;" /></a> <a href="#"><img align="left" alt="" src="https://placehold.it/94x50" style="margin:0;border:none;"/></a> <a href="#" target="_blank"><img align="left" alt="" class="" src="https://placehold.it/81x50" style="margin:0;border:none;" /></a> <img align="left" alt="" border="0" class="" src="https://placehold.it/245x50" style="margin:0; border:none;" />

</div>

</td>

</tr>

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: In Gmail App extra white line will appear at the footer section
Southeastern Railway – Rendering issue may occur in shadow image(Top and bottom)

solutions.solution: Replace the existing images with proper shadow images both top and bottom.

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: In Windows 10 Mail, the texts which are hyperlinked will get underlined

solutions.solution: Check the solution in here

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: In Windows 10 Mail, background images/spacer images wont get display
In some creative, only the images will display but the text part will be missed

solutions.solution:
This rendering issue will appear if the follwing code is there in the HTML head section

<!--[if gte mso 15]>
<style type="text/css" media="all">

            /* Outlook 2013 Height Fix */

body { font-size: 0; line-height: 0; }

tr { font-size: 1px; mso-line-height-alt: 0; mso-margin-top-alt: 1px;
            }

</style>

<![endif
            ]-->

To resolve this just remove those highlighted styles

<!--[if gte mso 15]>

<style type="text/css" media="all">

            /* Outlook 2013 Height Fix */

<![endif
            ]-->

Here is the screenshot of rendering issues with resolved one.

The image with the issue

The image with the issue resolved

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: In Yahoo domain (FF & Chrome) the creative will be completely left aligned

solutions.solution:
Check if the contents table has the 100% wrapper table. If it is there just add align="center" attribute to the contents table and the td which holds the contents table. If it is not there we need to create one with center aligned contents table like below 


<!-- wrapper table -->

<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<tbody>

<tr>

<td align="center" valign="top">

<!-- conent table -->

  <table width="600" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center">

  <tbody>

  <tr>

  <td valign="top">Here goes the actual contents</td>

  </tr>

  </tbody>

  </table>

<!-- conent table ends -->  

</td>

</tr>

</tbody>

</table>

<!-- wrapper table ends -->

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: White line will appear in the header part in Windows 10 Mail domain

solutions.solution: Check the solution in here

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: If footer section contains “Unsubscribe from M-Ticketing” it will not display correctly

solutions.solution:
This one will happen if the line hight value of the image or the containing <td>

To resolve the issue just remove the line-height and mso-line-height-rule:exactly for both image and the containing <td>

Here the source code with rendering issue

<td align="center" style="font-size: 11px; color: #767676; font-family: Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif; line-height: 12px; mso-line-height-rule: exactly; text-decoration: none">

<a class="" href="#" style="color:#767676; text-decoration:none;"><img alt="" class="" height="22" src="https://placehold.it/85x22" style="border:none; font-size:11px;" width="85"/></a>

</td>

Here the source code with rendering issue resolved

<td align="center" style="font-size: 11px; color: #767676; font-family: Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif; text-decoration: none">
<a class="" href="#" style="color:#767676; text-decoration:none;"><img alt="" class="" height="22" src="https://placehold.it/85x22" style="border:none; font-size:11px;" width="85"/></a>
</td>

Here is the screenshot of rendering issues with resolved one.

The screenshot of the issue and resolved

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: There will be double border in the Footer section after 3rd module and before Social Bar
Rendering Issue in the CTA button

solutions.solution: Check the solution in here

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: Round corner border is missing in the Right side of the Proof

solutions.solution:
Round corner border is missing in the top right side of the issue will appear if we slice the round edge images with less than the height of 16px. If we do slice the images with more than the height of 16px, we can avoid this rendering issue

The CTA button with round edge issue will be resovlved if we use the following vml script with CTA button code.

The script has two parts wrapped with a <div> tag first one is for all MS Office Outlook clients and the other part is for all other email clients except MS Office Outlook clients.

The first part of the code for MS Office Outlook is as follows

<!--[if mso]>

      <v:roundrect xmlns:v="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml" xmlns:w="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:word" href="#" style="height:40px;v-text-anchor:middle;width:310px;" arcsize="10%" strokecolor="#009cde" fillcolor="#009cde">

        <w:anchorlock/>

        <center style="color:#ffffff;font-family:Arial;font-size:14px; font-weight:bold;">CTA Text</center>

      </v:roundrect>

<![endif
            ]-->

In this arcsize="{acrsize%}" is the round edge size of the CTA button this value should be in percentage, strokecolor="#{strokecolor}" color of the border to the CTA fillcolor="{#fillcolor}" is the background-color of CTA & href="{link}" is the actual link for CTA. If there is no need of border give same color to both strokecolor and fillcolor

The second part of the code for all other clients except MS Office Outlook is as follows

<!--[if !(mso)]><!-->

<table width="310" class="container" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<tr> 

<td bgcolor="#009cde" style="font-family:Arial; font-size:16px; color:#666666; -moz-border-radius: 5px; -webkit-border-radius: 5px; border-radius: 5px;" valign="middle"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<tr>

<td style="font-family:Arial; font-size:14px; color:#FFFFFF;" valign="middle" align="center"><a style="display:block; text-decoration:none; color:#ffffff; padding:10px 0px 10px 0px; font-weight:bold;" href="#" target="_blank">CTA Text</a></td>

</tr>

</table></td>

</tr>

</table>

<!--<![endif
            ]-->

Both two parts wrapped with <div> will be as below

Here the width, height & background color of the CTA button varies depends on the requirement

<div>

<!--[if mso
            ]>

      <v:roundrect xmlns:v="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml" xmlns:w="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:word" href="#" style="height:40px;v-text-anchor:middle;width:310px;" arcsize="10%" strokecolor="#009cde" fillcolor="#009cde">

        <w:anchorlock/>

        <center style="color:#ffffff;font-family:Arial;font-size:14px; font-weight:bold;">CTA Text</center>

      </v:roundrect>

<![endif
            ]-->


<!--[if !(mso)
            ]><!-->

<table width="310" class="container" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<tr> 

<td bgcolor="#009cde" style="font-family:Arial; font-size:16px; color:#666666; -moz-border-radius: 5px; -webkit-border-radius: 5px; border-radius: 5px;" valign="middle"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<tr>

<td style="font-family:Arial; font-size:14px; color:#FFFFFF;" valign="middle" align="center"><a style="display:block; text-decoration:none; color:#ffffff; padding:10px 0px 10px 0px; font-weight:bold;" href="#" target="_blank">CTA Text</a></td>

</tr>

</table></td>

</tr>

</table>

<!--<![endif
            ]-->

</div>

Here is the screenshot of rendering issues with resolved one.

The screenshot of the issue and resolved

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: Date/time, address and phone number highlighting/underlining issue in Windows 10 Mail App

solutions.solution:
This will stop windows 10 Mail app from highlighting the Date/time , Address and Phone numbers
Note: This won't resolve the issue entirely this will remove the color highlights, but the dotted underline will be there

To avoid the Windows 10 Mail App address and phone number highlighting add the meta tag <meta name="format-detection" content="telephone=no"> and the following styles in the conditional comments for MS Outlook versions greater than 2016 in head section
Note: Here the conditional styles should be added before the closing head tag

<!--[if gt mso 15]>
<style type="text/css">
/*Windows 10 phone link fix*/
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink {
mso-style-priority: 100 !important;
color:inherit !important;
text-decoration:none !important;
}
</style>
<![endif ]-->

To remove underline to all the linked texts the following style should be added to the style tag in the head section
Note: Before doing the below steps make sure to add the syle text-decoration:underline; to all links which should come with underline.

a { text-decoration:none; }

Finally the head section should look like below

<head>
<meta charset="utf-8">
<meta name="format-detection" content="telephone=no">
<title>Untitled Document</title>
<style type="text/css">
body { font-family: arial; font-size: 14px; width: 80%; margin: 10px auto; }
.page-title { background-color: lightgrey; padding: 10px; border-radius: 5px; }
.text-center { text-align: center; }
code { padding: 10px; background-color: lightblue; display: block; }
span.code-highlight { background-color: yellow; }
a[href^="x-apple-data-detectors:" ] { color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit; }
a[x-apple-data-detectors ] { color: inherit !important; text-decoration: none !important; font-size: inherit !important; font-family: inherit !important; font-weight: inherit !important; line-height: inherit !important; }
a { text-decoration:none; }
</style>

<!-- Outlook specific codes goes here -->
<!--[if gt mso 14 ]>
<style type="text/css">
/* Hight issue fix for greaer than MS Outlook 2013*/
.height_01, #height_01 {
font-size: 1px;
line-height: 1px;
}
</style>
<![endif ]-->
<!--[if gt mso 15]>
<style type="text/css">
/*Windows 10 phone link fix*/
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink {
mso-style-priority: 100 !important;
color:inherit !important;
text-decoration:none !important;
}
</style>
<![endif ]-->
</head>

issuesAndSolutions.issue_name: Date/time, address and phone number highlighting/underlining issue in Apple devices

solutions.solution:
This will eliminate the blue+underline styling (tested on iPhone 5, iOS 8.3) [Source StakOverflow]

To remove the iphone address and phone number highlighting add the following code to the head tag in HTML creative

a[href^="x-apple-data-detectors:"] {
color: inherit;
text-decoration: inherit;
}

and

a[x-apple-data-detectors ] {
color: inherit !important;
text-decoration: none !important;
font-size: inherit !important;
font-family: inherit !important;
font-weight: inherit !important;
line-height: inherit !important;
}

Before adding the above code to style tag, make sure to add this meta tag to the head section

<meta name="format-detection" content="telephone=no">

Here is the screenshot of rendering issue and the resolved one

The image with the issue

The image with the issue resolved
